p: On the other hand, the EO obtained from the female CS exhibited a different chemical profile, with the predominance of monoterpene hydrocarbons (66.1%), such as myrcene (24.3%), terpinolene (10.6%), and α-pinene (11.4%). Here, the sesquiterpenes were in lower amounts (26.4%) and were represented by ( E)-caryophyllene (19.3%) and α-humulene (6.4%). It is important to note that the cannabinoid fraction was almost absent, with cannabidiol at trace levels or missing in the samples analyzed.
